ubuntuPrinciples.description: Ubuntu is a South African philosophy emphasizing human dignity, community, and interconnectedness. It has been recognized by the Constitutional Court as foundational to South African jurisprudence.

coreValues.name: Human Dignity (Isithunzi)
coreValues.description: The inherent worth of every person, central to Ubuntu and Section 10 of the Constitution

coreValues.name: Community (Umphakathi)
coreValues.description: The individual exists through the community - 'I am because we are'

coreValues.name: Compassion (Ububele)
coreValues.description: Empathy and care for others, especially the vulnerable

coreValues.name: Reconciliation (Ukubuyisana)
coreValues.description: Healing divisions and restoring relationships, foundational to post-apartheid SA

coreValues.name: Restorative Justice
coreValues.description: Focus on healing harm rather than punishment, influenced by Ubuntu

landmarkCases.name: S v Makwanyane
landmarkCases.significance: First major CC case to invoke Ubuntu, abolishing the death penalty
landmarkCases.ubuntuQuote: Ubuntu translates as humaneness. It expresses itself in umuntu ngumuntu ngabantu, describing the significance of group solidarity.

landmarkCases.name: Port Elizabeth Municipality v Various Occupiers
landmarkCases.significance: Applied Ubuntu to eviction cases, requiring consideration of human dignity
landmarkCases.ubuntuQuote: The spirit of Ubuntu, part of the deep cultural heritage of the majority of the population, suffuses the whole constitutional order.

landmarkCases.name: Dikoko v Mokhatla
landmarkCases.significance: Applied Ubuntu to defamation remedies, favoring apology over damages
landmarkCases.ubuntuQuote: Ubuntu emphasises the communal nature of society and 'carries in it the ideas of humaneness, social justice and fairness'.

landmarkCases.name: Afri-Forum v Malema
landmarkCases.significance: Applied Ubuntu in hate speech context
landmarkCases.ubuntuQuote: Ubuntu is recognised as being an important source of law within the context of strained or broken relationships.

landmarkCases.name: MEC for Education: KwaZulu-Natal v Pillay
landmarkCases.significance: Applied Ubuntu to religious and cultural rights in schools
landmarkCases.ubuntuQuote: Ubuntu is a culture which places some emphasis on communality and on the interdependence of the members of a community.

foundingValues.name: Human Dignity
foundingValues.description: Everyone has inherent dignity and the right to have their dignity respected and protected

foundingValues.name: Equality
foundingValues.description: Everyone is equal before the law and has the right to equal protection and benefit of the law

foundingValues.name: Human Rights and Freedoms
foundingValues.description: The advancement of human rights and freedoms

foundingValues.name: Non-racialism and Non-sexism
foundingValues.description: A society based on democratic values, social justice and fundamental human rights

foundingValues.name: Constitutional Supremacy
foundingValues.description: The Constitution is the supreme law; any law or conduct inconsistent with it is invalid

foundingValues.name: Rule of Law
foundingValues.description: The supremacy of the Constitution and the rule of law

foundingValues.name: Multi-party Democracy
foundingValues.description: Universal adult suffrage, regular elections, and a multi-party system

foundingValues.name: Accountability and Transparency
foundingValues.description: A government that is accountable, responsive and open

billOfRights.description: Chapter 2 of the Constitution - the cornerstone of democracy in South Africa

keyRights.name: Freedom and Security of the Person
Freedom of Religion, Belief and Opinion
Freedom of Trade, Occupation and Profession
Health Care, Food, Water and Social Security

courtHierarchy.description: South African court hierarchy for determining binding vs persuasive authority

courts.name: Constitutional Court
courts.description: Highest court in constitutional matters, decisions bind all other courts

courts.name: Supreme Court of Appeal
courts.description: Highest court in non-constitutional matters, binds all courts except CC

courts.name: High Courts
courts.description: Provincial divisions, bind magistrates courts in their jurisdiction

courts.name: Land Claims Court
courts.description: Specialized court for land restitution claims
